# NIDLTDOAMeasurement

**Class**

Information from a Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival anchor that you use to derive a range estimate.

## Declaration

```swift
class NIDLTDOAMeasurement
```

## Overview

Your app runs on a receiver device that fields messages from nearby physical base stations, or *anchors*. The framework processes the messages into instances of this class and provides them to your app through the  [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didUpdateDLTDOA:)] callback. Your app analyzes the measurements to calculate the receiver’s position relative to the anchors in the tracked area.

Only sessions that run a [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NIDLTDOAConfiguration] receive Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival measurements.

## Identifying the anchor

- **address**: A value that uniquely identifies an anchor in a tracked area.

## Locating the anchor

- **coordinates**: A triplet that represents the location in 3D space of the anchor that provides the measurement.
- **coordinatesType**: The type of coordinate system that the measurement conforms to.
- **signalStrength**: A value that represents the signal strength, in dBm, to the anchor that provides the measurement.

## Assessing time difference

- **receiveTime**: A timestamp, in seconds, for the time that the device receives the measurement.
- **transmitTime**: A timestamp, in seconds, for the elapsed message transmission time.

## Evaluating the message

- **measurementType**: The type of anchor message that the measurement derives from.
- **carrierFrequencyOffset**: The drift, as a ratio, across the frequencies of the receiver and the anchor.

## Measurements

- **NIDLTDOACoordinatesType**: The possible coordinate types for Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival measurement updates.
- **NIDLTDOAMeasurementType**: The possible phases of downlink positioning signals.
